file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-11-04-04 - READING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL READING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the pilot, copilot, and observer reading light mounting base. B. The pilot reading light is installed on the left side of the cockpit ceiling. The copilot and observer reading lights are installed on the right side of the cockpit ceiling. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITHOUT READING LIGHT MOUNTING BASE - RE- 33-11-04-000-801-A HEAD-UP DISPLAY MOVAL AIRCRAFT WITHOUT READING LIGHT MOUNTING BASE - IN- 33-11-04-400-801-A HEAD-UP DISPLAY STALLATION AIRCRAFT WITH 33-11-04-000-802-A READING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL HEAD-UP DISPLAY AIRCRAFT WITH READING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLA- 33-11-04-400-802-A HEAD-UP DISPLAY TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-11-04 Page 1 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-11-04-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITHOUT HEAD-UP DISPLAY 2. READING LIGHT MOUNTING BASE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the pilot, copilot, and observer reading light mounting base. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-12-01-000-801-A/400 COCKPIT LINING - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit ceiling I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, open the COCKPIT READING LIGHT circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the ceiling lining panel (4) ( AMM TASK 25-12-01-000-801-A/400). (2) Disconnect the electrical connections (5). (3) Remove the control assembly (1). (4) Remove the screws (2) and washers that attach the mounting base (3) to the ceiling lining panel (4). (5) Remove the mounting base (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-11-04 Page 2 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITHOUT HEAD-UP DISPLAY Reading Light Mounting Base - Removal/Installation Figure 401 ZONES 225 B 226 A DET. A 5. ELECTRICAL 2. SCREW CONNECTIONS WASHER 3. MOUNTING BASE 6. LAMP 4. CEILING LINING PANEL 1. CONTROL ASSEMBLY DET. B 145AMM330059.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-11-04 Page 3 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-11-04-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITHOUT HEAD-UP DISPLAY 3. READING LIGHT MOUNTING BASE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the pilot, copilot, and observer reading light mounting base. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-12-01-400-801-A/400 COCKPIT LINING - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 33-11-00-700-801-A/500 COCKPIT LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST AMM TASK 33-11-03-400-801-A/400 READING LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit ceiling I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the mounting base (3) in its position. (2) Tighten the screws (2) and washers that attach the mounting base (3) to the ceiling lining panel (4). (3) Remake the electrical connections (5). (4) Install a lamp (6) ( AMM TASK 33-11-03-400-801-A/400) if not installed. (5) Reinstall the control assembly (1). (6) Install the ceiling lining panel (4) ( AMM TASK 25-12-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-11-04 Page 4 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do the operational test of the reading light ( AMM TASK 33-11-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-11-04 Page 5 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-11-04-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH HEAD-UP DISPLAY 4. READING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the pilot, copilot, and observer reading light assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-12-01-000-801-A/400 COCKPIT LINING - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit ceiling I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, open the COCKPIT READING LIGHT circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. J. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) To remove the copilot and the observer reading light mounting base, do as follows: (a) Remove the ceiling lining panel (11) ( AMM TASK 25-12-01-000-801-A/400). (b) Disconnect the electrical connections (5). (c) Remove the control assembly (10). (d) Remove the screws (6) and washers (7) that attach the mounting base (8) to the ceiling lining panel (11). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-11-04 Page 6 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (e) Remove the mounting base (8). (2) To remove the pilot reading light assembly, do as follows: (a) Remove the ceiling lining panel (2) ( AMM TASK 25-12-01-000-801-A/400). (b) Remove the two electrical connections (4). (c) Remove the circlip (3) which attaches the pilot reading light assembly to the ceiling lining panel (2). (d) Remove the pilot reading light assembly (1) from the ceiling lining panel (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-11-04 Page 7 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH HEAD-UP DISPLAY Reading Light Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 402 ZONE 225 B C A 3. CIRCLIP DET. A 4. ELECTRICAL CONNECTIONS 5. ELECTRICAL 6. SCREW CONNECTIONS 7. WASHER 2. CEILING LINING PANEL 8. MOUNTING BASE 1. PILOT READING LIGHT ASSEMBLY 9. LAMP 11. CEILING LINING DET. C PANEL 10. CONTROL ASSEMBLY DET. B 145AMM330250.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-11-04 Page 8 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-11-04-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH HEAD-UP DISPLAY 5. READING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the pilot, copilot, and observer reading light assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-12-01-400-801-A/400 COCKPIT LINING - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 33-11-00-700-801-A/500 COCKPIT LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST AMM TASK 33-11-03-400-801-A/400 READING LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit ceiling I. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) To install the copilot and the observer reading light mounting base, do as follows: (a) Put the mounting base (8) in its position. (b) Tighten the screws (6) and washers (7) that attach the mounting base (8) to the ceiling lining panel (11). (c) Remake the electrical connections (5). (d) Install a lamp (9) ( AMM TASK 33-11-03-400-801-A/400) if not installed. (e) Reinstall the control assembly (10). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-11-04 Page 9 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (f) Install the ceiling lining panel (11) ( AMM TASK 25-12-01-400-801-A/400). (2) To install the pilot reading light assembly, do as follows: (a) Put the pilot reading light assembly (1) in its installation position. (b) Install the circlip (3) which attaches the pilot reading light assembly (1) to the ceiling lining panel (2). (c) Connect the two electrical connections (4). (d) Install a lamp ( AMM TASK 33-11-03-400-801-A/400) if not installed. (e) Install the ceiling lining panel (2) ( AMM TASK 25-12-01-400-801-A/400). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Do the operational test of the reading light ( AMM TASK 33-11-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-11-04 Page 10 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
